subject: p19454978
History: Sepsis, line pulled back a time.
Findings: Single portable supine AP image of the chest. The right IJ central line has been pulled back in the interval and now terminates in the superior direction junction. The lungs are well expanded. There has been interval mild increased cephalization of the pulmonary vessels, which may be partly or wholly due to supine positioning, making it difficult to evaluate for pulmonary edema. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. The cardiomediastinal silhouette is stable.
Impression: Right IJ central line terminates in the superior cavoatrial junction. Interval mild increased cephalization of the pulmonary vessels, which may be partly or wholly due to supine positioning, making it difficult to evaluate for pulmonary edema.
